meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be cured.
meanings.sent1: The curability of the common cold is high with proper treatment.
meanings.sent2: Doctors are optimistic about the curability of the patient's illness.
meanings.sent3: The curability of a broken toy depends on how skilled you are at fixing things.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude increased the curability of her emotional wounds.
meanings.sent5: The curability of a plant wilting can be improved with more sunlight and water.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of being able to be cured.
meanings.sent1: The doctor discussed the curability of the disease with the patient's family.
meanings.sent2: Research shows a correlation between early detection and curability of cancer.
meanings.sent3: The curability of a headache can sometimes be improved by drinking water.
meanings.sent4: The curability of a broken heart may depend on time and self-care.
meanings.sent5: The curability of a stain on a shirt depends on the type of fabric and the cleaning method used.
